words.source: H7200 wayyiqtol 1cs Niphal of רָאָה 'to appear, be seen'; KJV 'I appeared', ESV 'I appeared', NASB 'I appeared'
H413 prep. 'to, toward'; all trans. agree
H85 proper name; all trans. agree
H413 prep. 'to, toward'; all trans. agree
H3327 proper name; all trans. agree
H413 conj. + prep. 'and to'; all trans. agree
H3290 proper name; all trans. agree
H410 prep. b- + n.ms ʾel 'God, mighty one'; KJV 'by the name of God', ESV 'as God', NASB 'as God'. Part of compound divine title El Shaddai (H410+H7706)
H7706 n.ms Shaddai 'Almighty'; KJV 'Almighty', ESV 'Almighty', NASB 'Almighty'. Theologically significant patriarchal divine name, El Shaddai = 'God Almighty'
H8034 conj. + n.ms shem 'name' + 1cs suff.; KJV 'by my name', ESV 'by my name', NASB 'by My name'
H3068 divine name, Tetragrammaton; KJV 'JEHOVAH', ESV 'the LORD', NASB 'the LORD'
H3808 neg. particle lo 'not'; all trans. agree

H3045 Niphal perf. 1cs of יָדַע 'to know'; DIVERGENT: KJV 'was I not known' (Niphal = passive, 'was known'), ESV 'I did not make myself known' (reflexive reading), NASB 'I did not make Myself known' (reflexive). Debated: whether patriarchs knew the name YHWH or only its full covenantal significance
prep. l- + 3mp suff.; KJV 'unto them', ESV 'to them', NASB 'to them'
